content.description: The name is supposed to be "Whatshername", but I guess its not that important.  Climbs a left-facing corner.  Eases toward the top.
content.protection: Pro to 2.5 inches.  There is now a bolted anchor, no walk off required.
content.location: On the right side of the Right Tower.

content.description: I probably enjoyed this pitch the most of any I did at PB.  Four stars if it were longer.  Sustained technical face & crack climbing with good albeit small gear transitioning to a fun short wide section.
content.protection: RPs at the start, then  small nuts and cams until the crack quickly widens up to #4 Camalot.
content.location: The most obvious line on the Right Tower.  Starts with thin double cracks and ends with a right facing corner containing a wide crack.

content.description: I thought the crux was the lower third of the route.  At the top of the wide section at the top (moderate) work left to join the top of What'shisface and those anchors.
content.location: This is the crack to the right of What'shisface that starts with a thinner crack and heads up to a wideish looking break.  Joins What'shisface at the top and uses those anchors to get down.

content.description: The wide section at the bottom is the crux, it's a bit grunty.  The crack above is more moderate.  At the top, traverse right, passing a bolt that protects this easy traverse to the What'shisface anchors.  Lower from these anchors.
content.protection: Gear to 4", with a bolt at the top to protect the traverse right over to the What'shisface anchors
content.location: This is the dihedral that starts with a wide section at the base, to the left of What'shisface, on the left of the right tower.

content.description: Work your way to a 'jug' in the corner, then step up a bit further and transition to the right (fairly stout) to a solid stance.  Enter the next shallow, right facing corner and work your way to the anchor.  There is pro, but it's a bit tricky and has the potential to get in the way of holds one may want to use.  This may be better on TR, unless you're really solid at the grade.
content.protection: ring anchor, gear to 2" (optional 3-4" piece for the short, fat section near the top)
content.location: Start in the shallow, right facing dihedral immediately right of What'shername/What'sherface (shared anchor).
